quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: If you don't stand for something, you will fall for anything.
author: Malcolm X

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
author: David Brinkley

quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

quote: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
